memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< object_id_type > &ids, optional< bool > subscribe=optional< bool >()) const
memberdef.name: get_objects

briefdescription.para: Get the objects corresponding to the provided IDs.

detaileddescription.para:
ids
IDs of the objects to retrieve
subscribe
true to subscribe to the queried objects; false to not subscribe; null to subscribe or not subscribe according to current auto-subscription setting (see set_auto_subscription)
The objects retrieved, in the order they are mentioned in ids
operation_history_object (1.11.x) and account_transaction_history_object (2.9.x) can not be subscribed. If any of the provided IDs does not map to an object, a null variant is returned in its position.

briefdescription.para: Register a callback handle which then can be used to subscribe to object database changes.

detaileddescription.para:
cb
The callback handle to register
notify_remove_create
Whether subscribe to universal object creation and removal events. If this is set to true, the API server will notify all newly created objects and ID of all newly removed objects to the client, no matter whether client subscribed to the objects. By default, API servers don't allow subscribing to universal events, which can be changed on server startup.
Note: auto-subscription is enabled by default and can be disabled with set_auto_subscription API.

briefdescription.para: Set auto-subscription behavior of follow-up API queries.

detaileddescription.para:
enable
whether follow-up API queries will automatically subscribe to queried objects
Impacts behavior of these APIs:
get_accounts
get_assets
get_objects
lookup_accounts
get_full_accounts
get_htlc
Note: auto-subscription is enabled by default

briefdescription.para: Register a callback handle which will get notified when a transaction is pushed to database.

detaileddescription.para:
cb
The callback handle to register
Note: a transaction can be pushed to database and be popped from database several times while processing, before and after included in a block. Everytime when a push is done, the client will be notified.

briefdescription.para: Register a callback handle which will get notified when a block is pushed to database.

parameterdescription.para: The callback handle to register

briefdescription.para: Stop receiving any notifications.

detaileddescription.para: This unsubscribes from all subscribed markets and objects.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a block header.

parameterdescription.para: Height of the block whose header should be returned

simplesect.para: header of the referenced block, or null if no matching block was found

briefdescription.para: Retrieve multiple block header by block numbers.

parameterdescription.para: vector containing heights of the block whose header should be returned

simplesect.para: array of headers of the referenced blocks, or null if no matching block was found

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a full, signed block.

parameterdescription.para: Height of the block to be returned

simplesect.para: the referenced block, or null if no matching block was found

briefdescription.para: used to fetch an individual transaction.

parameterdescription.para: height of the block to fetch
the index (sequence number) of the transaction in the block, starts from 0

simplesect.para: the transaction at the given position

detaileddescription.para: If the transaction has not expired, this method will return the transaction for the given ID or it will return NULL if it is not known. Just because it is not known does not mean it wasn't included in the blockchain.

parameterdescription.para: hash of the transaction

simplesect.para: the corresponding transaction if found, or null if not found

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the graphene::chain::chain_property_object associated with the chain.
Retrieve the current graphene::chain::global_property_object.
Retrieve compile-time constants.
Get the chain ID.
Retrieve the current graphene::chain::dynamic_global_property_object.
Get all accounts that refer to the specified public keys in their owner authority, active authorities or memo key.

parameterdescription.para: a list of public keys to query

simplesect.para: ID of all accounts that refer to the specified keys

detaileddescription.para:
Determine whether a textual representation of a public key (in Base-58 format) is currently linked to any registered (i.e. non-stealth) account on the blockchain
public_key
Public key
Whether a public key is known

briefdescription.para: Get account object from a name or ID.

parameterdescription.para: name or ID of the account

simplesect.para: Account ID

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< std::string > &account_names_or_ids, optional< bool > subscribe=optional< bool >()) const
memberdef.name: get_accounts

briefdescription.para: Get a list of accounts by names or IDs.

detaileddescription.para:
account_names_or_ids
names or IDs of the accounts to retrieve
subscribe
true to subscribe to the queried account objects; false to not subscribe; null to subscribe or not subscribe according to current auto-subscription setting (see set_auto_subscription)
The accounts corresponding to the provided names or IDs This function has semantics identical to get_objects

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< string > &names_or_ids, optional< bool > subscribe=optional< bool >())
memberdef.name: get_full_accounts

briefdescription.para: Fetch all objects relevant to the specified accounts and optionally subscribe to updates.

detaileddescription.para:
names_or_ids
Each item must be the name or ID of an account to retrieve
subscribe
true to subscribe to the queried full account objects; false to not subscribe; null to subscribe or not subscribe according to current auto-subscription setting (see set_auto_subscription)
Map of string from names_or_ids to the corresponding account This function fetches all relevant objects for the given accounts, and subscribes to updates to the given accounts. If any of the strings in names_or_ids cannot be tied to an account, that input will be ignored. All other accounts will be retrieved and subscribed.

briefdescription.para: Get info of an account by name.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the account to retrieve

simplesect.para: The account holding the provided name

briefdescription.para: Get all accounts that refer to the specified account in their owner or active authorities.

parameterdescription.para: Account name or ID to query

simplesect.para: all accounts that refer to the specified account in their owner or active authorities

briefdescription.para: Get a list of accounts by name.

detaileddescription.para:
account_names
Names of the accounts to retrieve
The accounts holding the provided names This function has semantics identical to get_objects, but doesn't subscribe.

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &lower_bound_name, uint32_t limit, optional< bool > subscribe=optional< bool >()) const
memberdef.name: lookup_accounts

briefdescription.para: Get names and IDs for registered accounts.

parameterdescription.para: Lower bound of the first name to return
Maximum number of results to return must not exceed 1000
true to subscribe to the queried account objects; false to not subscribe; null to subscribe or not subscribe according to current auto-subscription setting (see set_auto_subscription)

simplesect.para: Map of account names to corresponding IDs
In addition to the common auto-subscription rules, this API will subscribe to the returned account only if limit is 1.

briefdescription.para: Get an account's balances in various assets.

parameterdescription.para: name or ID of the account to get balances for
IDs of the assets to get balances of; if empty, get all assets account has a balance in

simplesect.para: Balances of the account

briefdescription.para: Semantically equivalent to get_account_balances.
Return all unclaimed balance objects for a list of addresses.

parameterdescription.para: a list of addresses

simplesect.para: all unclaimed balance objects for the addresses

briefdescription.para: Calculate how much assets in the given balance objects are able to be claimed at current head block time.

parameterdescription.para: a list of balance object IDs

simplesect.para: a list indicating how much asset in each balance object is available to be claimed

briefdescription.para: Return all vesting balance objects owned by an account.

parameterdescription.para: name or ID of an account

simplesect.para: all vesting balance objects owned by the account

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of accounts registered with the blockchain.
Get asset ID from an asset symbol or ID.

parameterdescription.para: symbol name or ID of the asset

simplesect.para: asset ID

memberdef.name: get_assets

briefdescription.para: Get a list of assets by symbol names or IDs.

detaileddescription.para:
asset_symbols_or_ids
symbol names or IDs of the assets to retrieve
subscribe
true to subscribe to the queried asset objects; false to not subscribe; null to subscribe or not subscribe according to current auto-subscription setting (see set_auto_subscription)
The assets corresponding to the provided symbol names or IDs This function has semantics identical to get_objects

briefdescription.para: Get assets alphabetically by symbol name.

parameterdescription.para: Lower bound of symbol names to retrieve
Maximum number of assets to fetch (must not exceed 101)

simplesect.para: The assets found

briefdescription.para: Get a list of assets by symbol names or IDs.

detaileddescription.para:
symbols_or_ids
symbol names or IDs of the assets to retrieve
The assets corresponding to the provided symbols or IDs This function has semantics identical to get_objects, but doesn't subscribe

briefdescription.para: Get assets count.

simplesect.para: The assets count

memberdef.name: get_assets_by_issuer

briefdescription.para: Get assets issued (owned) by a given account.

parameterdescription.para: Account name or ID to get objects from
Asset objects(1.3.X) before this ID will be skipped in results. Pagination purposes.
Maximum number of orders to retrieve

simplesect.para: The assets issued (owned) by the account

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string a, std::string b, uint32_t limit) const
memberdef.name: get_limit_orders

briefdescription.para: Get limit orders in a given market.

parameterdescription.para: symbol or ID of asset being sold
symbol or ID of asset being purchased
Maximum number of orders to retrieve

simplesect.para: The limit orders, ordered from least price to greatest

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &account_name_or_id, optional< uint32_t > limit=101, optional< limit_order_id_type > start_id=optional< limit_order_id_type >())
memberdef.name: get_limit_orders_by_account

briefdescription.para: Fetch open limit orders in all markets relevant to the specified account, ordered by ID.

parameterdescription.para: The name or ID of an account to retrieve
The limitation of items each query can fetch, not greater than a configured value
Start order id, fetch orders whose IDs are greater than or equal to this order

simplesect.para: List of limit orders of the specified account

listitem.para: if account_name_or_id cannot be tied to an account, an error will be returned
limit can be omitted or be null, if so the default value 101 will be used
start_id can be omitted or be null, if so the api will return the "first page" of orders
can only omit one or more arguments in the end of the list, but not one or more in the middle

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &account_name_or_id, const string &base, const string &quote, uint32_t limit=101, optional< limit_order_id_type > ostart_id=optional< limit_order_id_type >(), optional< price > ostart_price=optional< price >())
memberdef.name: get_account_limit_orders

briefdescription.para: Fetch all orders relevant to the specified account and specified market, result orders are sorted descendingly by price.

parameterdescription.para: The name or ID of an account to retrieve
Base asset
Quote asset
The limitation of items each query can fetch, not greater than 101
Start order id, fetch orders which price lower than this order, or price equal to this order but order ID greater than this order
Fetch orders with price lower than or equal to this price

simplesect.para: List of orders from account_name_or_id to the corresponding account

listitem.para: if account_name_or_id cannot be tied to an account, an error will be returned

ostart_id and ostart_price can be empty, if so the api will return the "first page" of orders; if ostart_id is specified, its price will be used to do page query preferentially, otherwise the ostart_price will be used; ostart_id and ostart_price may be used cooperatively in case of the order specified by ostart_id was just canceled accidentally, in such case, the result orders' price may lower or equal to ostart_price, but orders' id greater than ostart_id

briefdescription.para: Get call orders (aka margin positions) for a given asset.

Maximum number of orders to retrieve

simplesect.para: The call orders, ordered from earliest to be called to latest

account_name_or_id

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< void(const variant &)> callback, const std::string &a, const std::string &b)
memberdef.name: subscribe_to_market

briefdescription.para: Request notification when the active orders in the market between two assets changes.

detaileddescription.para:
callback
Callback method which is called when the market changes
a
symbol name or ID of the first asset
b
symbol name or ID of the second asset
Callback will be passed a variant containing a vector<pair<operation, operation_result>>. The vector will contain, in order, the operations which changed the market, and their results.

briefdescription.para: Unsubscribe from updates to a given market.

parameterdescription.para: symbol name or ID of the first asset
symbol name or ID of the second asset

briefdescription.para: Returns the ticker for the market assetA:assetB.

parameterdescription.para: symbol name or ID of the base asset
symbol name or ID of the quote asset

simplesect.para: The market ticker for the past 24 hours.

briefdescription.para: Returns the 24 hour volume for the market assetA:assetB.

parameterdescription.para: symbol name or ID of the base asset
symbol name or ID of the quote asset

simplesect.para: The market volume over the past 24 hours

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &base, const string &quote, unsigned limit=50) const
memberdef.name: get_order_book

briefdescription.para: Returns the order book for the market base:quote.

parameterdescription.para: symbol name or ID of the base asset
symbol name or ID of the quote asset
depth of the order book to retrieve, for bids and asks each, capped at 50

simplesect.para: Order book of the market

briefdescription.para: Returns vector of tickers sorted by reverse base_volume Note: this API is experimental and subject to change in next releases.

parameterdescription.para: Max number of results

simplesect.para: Desc Sorted ticker vector

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &base, const string &quote, fc::time_point_sec start, fc::time_point_sec stop, unsigned limit=100) const
memberdef.name: get_trade_history

briefdescription.para: Returns recent trades for the market base:quote, ordered by time, most recent first. Note: Currently, timezone offsets are not supported. The time must be UTC. The range is [stop, start). In case when there are more than 100 trades occurred in the same second, this API only returns the first 100 records, can use another API get_trade_history_by_sequence to query for the rest.

parameterdescription.para: symbol or ID of the base asset
symbol or ID of the quote asset
Start time as a UNIX timestamp, the latest trade to retrieve
Stop time as a UNIX timestamp, the earliest trade to retrieve
Number of trasactions to retrieve, capped at 100.

simplesect.para: Recent transactions in the market

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &base, const string &quote, int64_t start, fc::time_point_sec stop, unsigned limit=100) const
memberdef.name: get_trade_history_by_sequence

briefdescription.para: Returns trades for the market base:quote, ordered by time, most recent first. Note: Currently, timezone offsets are not supported. The time must be UTC. The range is [stop, start).

parameterdescription.para: symbol or ID of the base asset
symbol or ID of the quote asset
Start sequence as an Integer, the latest trade to retrieve
Stop time as a UNIX timestamp, the earliest trade to retrieve
Number of trasactions to retrieve, capped at 100

simplesect.para: Transactions in the market

Given a set of votes, return the objects they are voting for.

votes
a list of vote IDs
the referenced objects This will be a mixture of committee_member_objects, witness_objects, and worker_objects
The results will be in the same order as the votes. Null will be returned for any vote IDs that are not found.

detaileddescription.para: This API will take a partially signed transaction and a set of public keys that the owner has the ability to sign for and return the minimal subset of public keys that should add signatures to the transaction.

parameterdescription.para: the transaction to be signed
a set of public keys

simplesect.para: a subset of available_keys that could sign for the given transaction

detaileddescription.para: This method will return the set of all public keys that could possibly sign for a given transaction. This call can be used by wallets to filter their set of public keys to just the relevant subset prior to calling get_required_signatures to get the minimum subset.

parameterdescription.para: the transaction to be signed

simplesect.para: a set of public keys that could possibly sign for the given transaction

detaileddescription.para: This method will return the set of all addresses that could possibly sign for a given transaction.

parameterdescription.para: the transaction to be signed

simplesect.para: a set of addresses that could possibly sign for the given transaction

detaileddescription.para:
Check whether a transaction has all of the required signatures
trx
a transaction to be verified
true if the trx has all of the required signatures, otherwise throws an exception

briefdescription.para: The database_api class implements the RPC API for the chain database.

detaileddescription.para: This API exposes accessors on the database which query state tracked by a blockchain validating node. This API is read-only; all modifications to the database must be performed via transactions. Transactions are broadcast via the network_broadcast_api.
